channel.title: Help with getting forums online
channel.description: b4 anyone says use the search i just wanted to let ppl know that i did and i couldnt find anything...now getting to the point of this topic. Ok what im trying to do is get my forums online so ppl can register and post and what not. im using rscd source. ive done this before like 8months ago so i still remember some of it but not all of it. what i have done is i deleted all the files out of the cache folder then i went into phpmyadmin and manually entered my global ip and saved it. then i loaded my forums page logged in and went to the admin part and changed the ip under options. when i try to get on the forums by typing in my global ip it just says "opps link doesnt exist" or something like that...is there something i did wrong or can anyone help me figure this out?

item.title: Help with getting forums online
item.dc:creator: @pesterd pesterd
item.description:
@pesterd wrote:

i need your STATIC IP not your DNS thing

Read full topic

item.title: Help with getting forums online
item.dc:creator: @Deathman17 Deathman17
item.description:
@Deathman17 wrote:

when i install wamp i left the smtp as localhost…was i suppose to change that?

Read full topic

item.title: Help with getting forums online
item.dc:creator: @pesterd pesterd
item.description:
@pesterd wrote:

whats the adress, send it to me in a PM and also, your laptop is probably on the same network as your desktop

Read full topic

item.title: Help with getting forums online
item.dc:creator: @Deathman17 Deathman17
item.description:
@Deathman17 wrote:

i have it port forwarded correctly

Read full topic

item.title: Help with getting forums online
item.dc:creator: @pesterd pesterd
item.description:
@pesterd wrote:

did you portforward correctly? you can just connet with the IP adress also, it could be, yout laptop is on the same network

Read full topic

item.title: Help with getting forums online
item.dc:creator: @Deathman17 Deathman17
item.description:
@Deathman17 wrote:

yeah im using wamp to run it and its turned on…im able to get on by going to http://localhost/ on my desktop that is hosting it but when i get on my laptop and try to go to the forums by going to my global ip addess i get a message saying link is broke

Read full topic

item.title: Help with getting forums online
item.dc:creator: @pesterd pesterd
item.description:
@pesterd wrote:

OK, then, in that case, you must make sure your wamp server or xxampplite is turned on.
Google search either or to download it.

I suggest using WAMP for beginners

Read full topic

item.title: Help with getting forums online
item.dc:creator: @Deathman17 Deathman17
item.description:
@Deathman17 wrote:

yeah your right…deleted what i said…to the first guy…i did read your tut but it didnt work for me…basicly when i try to go to the forums site using my global ip it doesnt work…dunno if im doing something wrong…to the second guy…yeah i lost my temper lol…but i deleted it…no sense in getting mad over something like that

Read full topic

item.title: Help with getting forums online

item.description:

Ok first of all i want to say hello and welcome you noob.
second you not use the search bottom, if you would have used it then you would have come to my Tutorial on (How to setup rscd v25) there a perfect TuT on how to set up the forum to. so goodbye to you now.

Ok what im trying to do is get my forums online so ppl can register and post and what not. im using rscd source. ive done this before like 8months ago so i still remember some of it but not all of it. what i have done is i deleted all the files out of the cache folder then i went into phpmyadmin and manually entered my global ip and saved it. then i loaded my forums page logged in and went to the admin part and changed the ip under options. when i try to get on the forums by typing in my global ip it just says “opps link doesnt exist” or something like that…is there something i did wrong or can anyone help me figure this out?
